title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Sande Bank’s liabilities are $15,000 and/or does not explain that demand deposits are a bank’s liabilities.
The response states that Sande Bank’s liabilities are $15,000 and explains that demand deposits are a bank’s liabilities.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate Sande Bank’s required reserves as $3,000 and/or does not show the work.

Required Reserves=$15,000×20%=$3,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@551D@

The response calculates Sande Bank’s required reserves as $3,000 and shows the work.

Required Reserves=$15,000×20%=$3,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@551D@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the dollar value of the maximum amount of new loans Sande Bank can make is $2,000 and/or does not explain that Sande Bank can lend out its excess reserves, which are $2,000 ( =$5,000−$3,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@408E@ ).

The response states that the dollar value of the maximum amount of new loans Sande Bank can make is $2,000 and explains that Sande Bank can lend out its excess reserves, which are $2,000 ( =$5,000−$3,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@408E@ ).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the maximum amount by which the money supply can increase throughout the banking system as $10,000 and/or does not show the work.

Excess Reserves×Money Multiplier=$2,000× 1 0.2 =$10,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@64FD@

The response calculates the maximum amount by which the money supply can increase throughout the banking system as $10,000 and shows the work.

Excess Reserves×Money Multiplier=$2,000× 1 0.2 =$10,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@64FD@

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the central bank should sell bonds and/or does not explain that the open-market sale will cause the money supply to decrease and the nominal interest rate to increase.
The response states that the central bank should sell bonds and explains that the open-market sale will cause the money supply to decrease and the nominal interest rate to increase.
